html:
Due to recent changes within the music industry and live events in Mexico, as well as new regulations issued by the authorities, Pitchfork Music Festival CDMX 2025 will have a new configuration with the aim to guarantee a safe and organized experience for everyone.

The shows programmed or Friday, May 2; Saturday, May 3; and Sunday, May 4, will still take place, but there are some changes to the scheduling. Black Country, New Road, will now perform on May 2, at Estadio Fray Nano.

These changes are not taken lightly, and they are done in order to comply fully with new event guidelines established by Mexican authorities. We deeply appreciate your understanding and trust.

If you purchased a ticket for May 2 or May 3, your ticket remains valid. Additionally, if you purchased a ticket for May 3, you will also be able to attend the festival on May 2 with the same ticket.

If you purchased a General or VIP Passport, you get access to the full program (Thursday through Saturday). Additionally, you may choose one of the following benefits:

  • We will credit the difference in ticket price as balance for on-site purchases within the festival (CASFID cashless payment system).
  • You will receive General or VIP access (according to your original ticket) to Hipnosis Festival 2025. Stay tuned for the first confirmed artists soon!
  • You may request a refund for your ticket.

Those who purchased a single-day ticket for May 2 or May 3, but not a Passport, you may receive a 30% discount on Hipnosis Festival blind phase tickets.

For refunds, please contact Fever: hello@feverup.com.

Pitchfork Music Festival CDMX 2025

Thursday, May 1, 2025, at Foro Indie Rocks!

  • NAAFI PRESENTS: DJ Fucci, Imaabs B2B ZutZut
  • Luz, Luz, Luz!
